turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: I'm Ray --

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I'm Peter --

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Careful, Winston.  He's a mean one.  And to celebrate our grand reopening, we're giving you twice the value with our special half-price 'Welcome Back' service plan.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Hold on, Ray!  Half-price!  Have you gone crazy?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: I guess so, Pete, because that's not all. Tell them what else we've got, Egon.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: You know he ran that last lap in under six minutes?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: If he wasn't dead he'd be an Olympic prospect.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Oh good, you're here.  Spengler and I have something really amazing to show you.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: It's not that thing you do with your nostrils, is it?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: And now you're going to eat it?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: No, I'm just restoring it to its normal state.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: This is what you do with your spare time?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: This is an incredible breakthrough, Venkman. A psychoreactive substance!  Whatever this is, it clearly responds to human emotional states.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: 'Mood slime.'  We ought to bottle this stuff and sell it.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Like a goat on garbage.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: We're running tests to see if we can get an equally strong positive reaction.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: What kind of tests?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Well, we sing to it, we talk to it, we say supportive, nurturing things --

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: You're not sleeping with this stuff, are you?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Did you find anything at Dana's?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Nothing.  Just some mood-slime residue in and around the bathtub.  But we did turn up some interesting stuff on this Vigo character you mentioned.  I found the name Vigo the Carpathian in Leon Zundinger's Magicians, Martyrs and Madmen.  Listen to this:

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Beautiful, beautiful.  Work with me, baby. Just have fun with it.  Okay, he's playing it cool.  Let's finish up and get out of here.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: I'll get one more reading.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: You just picked up three penalty points on your driver's license.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Don't tell me, let me guess.  All-you-can-eat barbecue rib night at the Sizzler?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: We're going down into the sewer system to see if we can trace the source of the psycho-reactive slime flow.  We thought you might want to come along.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Darn it!  I wish I'd known you were going. I'm stuck with these damn dinner reservations.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I think we're going to have to pass on the sewer trip, boys.  Let me know what you find out.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Okay, but you're missing all the fun.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: You should've been there, Venkman. Absolutely incredible!

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Yeah, sorry I missed it.  I guess you guys didn't know about the dress code here.  It's really kind of a coat and tie place.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: It's all over the city, Pete -- well, under it actually.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: It looks like a giant Jello mold.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I hate Jello.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Forget it.  The Vienna Boys Choir couldn't get through this stuff.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Good effort.  Now what?  Should we say supportive, nurturing things to it, Ray?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: I hope we have enough stuff to do the job.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Only one way to find out.  Ready, Teddy?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: I'll keep to the middle of the channel. We're okay to 59th Street, then we'll go ashore and take First Avenue to 79th.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Are you kidding?  We'll hit all that bridge traffic at 59th.  I'm going to take 72nd straight up to Fifth.  Trust me, I used to drive a cab.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: I don't think they make Nikes in her size.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: We're almost there, Lib.  Step on it.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: My Fault!

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: She's new in town.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Vigi, Vigi, Vigi -- you have been a bad little monkey.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: The whole city's together on this one.  We took a vote.  Everybody's down on you, you know.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I think she looks pretty good here, don't you?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Yeah, and a lot easier to get to than that island.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: My great-grandparents were Swiss.  I still have the pictures they took of the statue from the boat when they arrived.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Oh, right, you told me that.  They came to America seeking other kinds of cheese, as I recall.  How about you, Winston?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: What's your story, Pete?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Me?  I'm a little of everything.  Some Irish, some German, some French, Dutch -- the women in my family slept around.  And that's what made this country great.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: I'm ready.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Then let's do it.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: That's it, Ray.  I've had it.  No more parties. I'm tired of taking abuse from over-privileged nine-year-olds.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Come on, Winston.  We can't quit now.  The holidays are coming up.  It's our best season.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Give it up, Ray.  You're living in the past. Ghostbusters doesn't exist anymore.  In a year these kids won't even remember who we are.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Ungrateful little Yuppie larvae.  After all we did for this city.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Yeah, what did we do, Ray?  The last real job we had we bubbled up a hundred foot marshmallow man and blew the top three floors off an uptown highrise.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Yeah, but what a ride.  You can't make a hamburger without chopping up a cow.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Does it have any favorites?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: It likes all the sappy stuff: 'Cumbaya,' 'Everything is Beautiful,' 'It's a Small World' -- but it loves Jackie Wilson.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: And he didn't die of old age either.  He was poisoned, stabbed, shot, hung, stretched, disemboweled, drawn and quartered.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: I guess he wasn't too popular at the end there.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: You got a flux and a half.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Now if you don't want to be the --  -- fifth person ever to die in meta-shock from a planar rift, I suggest you get down behind that desk and don't move until we give you the signal "Stabilize -- All Clear."

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Now that's one ugly dude.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Huh?  What?

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: You finished here?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: What?  Yeah.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Are you all right?  You coming down with something?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: No, I'm fine.  I just got light-headed for a second there.  Let's go.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Are you telling me how to drive?

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: No, I just thought --

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Well don't think!

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Yeah, I guess so.  It was the strangest thing.  I knew what I was doing but I couldn't stop.  This really terrible feeling came over me and -- I don't know -- I just felt like driving into that tree and ending it all.  Whew!  Sorry, boys.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Nice going, Ray!  What were you trying to do -- drown me?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Look, Zeddemore, it wasn't my fault you were too stupid to drop that line.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: You better watch your mouth, man, or I'll punch your lights out.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Oh yeah?  Anytime, anytime.  Just go ahead and try it.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: What are we doing?  Ray, I was ready to kill you.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Don't you see?  It's the slime.  That stuff is like pure, concentrated evil.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: She's moving!

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: I've lived in New York all my life and I never visited the Statue of Liberty.  Now I finally get here and we're taking her out for a walk.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Ray -- Ray -- How do you feel, man?

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Groovy.  I've never felt better in my life.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I don't care what you say.  This could be a major Christmas gift item.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Right, and the first time someone gets mad, their toaster will eat their hand.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: So we'll put a warning on the label.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Tell him about the toaster.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I don't think he's ready for the toaster.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: It better not start yet.  I'm trying to finish my potholder before lunch.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: You think all those predictions about the world coming to an end in the 1990s are true?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: And pure --

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: And decent.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Kind of makes you wonder, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: Wonder what?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: If she's naked under that toga.  She's French, you know.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: How deep does it get?  That water's cold and I can't swim.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: It's okay.  I have my Senior Lifesaving card.

turns.speaker: WINSTON
turns.text: My people weren't taking any pictures from those slave ships, man.  And there wasn't any Statue in Charleston Harbor to welcome them, either.  What are you, Dana?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Miss Blue Blood?  Her family's been here since the year 12.

turns.speaker: BRIDE
turns.text: Aren't you glad we waited?

turns.speaker: GROOM
turns.text: I don't know.  It probably would've been the same.

turns.speaker: BRIDE
turns.text: Well, thanks a lot.

turns.speaker: BRIDE
turns.text: Roy?  Your clock broke.

turns.speaker: GROOM
turns.text: Nice going, honey.  It was brand new.

turns.speaker: BRIDE
turns.text: I didn't break your precious clock, Roy!

turns.speaker: BRIDE
turns.text: Now where are you going?

turns.speaker: GROOM
turns.text: To the bathroom, where do you think?

turns.speaker: BRIDE
turns.text: Have I done the right thing?

turns.speaker: BRIDE
turns.text: Hey, sweetheart, will you CUT THAT OUT!!!

turns.speaker: GROOM
turns.text: Uuuuuuugh!!

turns.speaker: BRIDE
turns.text: What's the matter, dear?

turns.speaker: COED
turns.text: Is it a star?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: It is a star!  That's great.  You're very good.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Ready?  What is it?

turns.speaker: COED
turns.text: Ummm -- figure eight?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Incredible!  Five for five.  You're not cheating on me here, are you?

turns.speaker: COED
turns.text: No.  They're just coming to me.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Well, you're doing great.  Keep it up.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Well, I guess some people have it and some don't.

turns.speaker: COED
turns.text: Do you think I have it, Dr. Venkman?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Definitely.  I think you may be a very gifted telepath.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Okay.  Just give me a second here.  I have to leave now but if you've got some time I'd like you to come back this evening and do some more work with me.

turns.speaker: COED
turns.text: Eight o'clock?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I was just going to say "eight."  You're fantastic!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Oh, Dana, it's you ...

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Hi, Louis.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: ... I thought it was the drug store.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Are you sick, Louis?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Oh, no, I feel great.  I just ordered some more vitamins.  I see you were exercising. So was I.  I taped "20 Minute Workout" and played it back at high speed so it only took ten minutes and I got a really good workout. You wanna have a mineral water with me?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: No thanks, Louis.  I'm really tired.  I've been rehearsing all morning.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Okay.  I'll take a raincheck.  I always have plenty of mineral water and other nutritious health foods, but you know that.  Listen, that reminds me, I'm having a party for all my clients.  It's gonna be my fourth anniversary as an accountant.  I know you fill out your own tax return, but I'd like you to come being that you're my next door neighbor and all ...

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Oh, that's nice, Louis.  I'll stop by if I'm around.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You know you shouldn't leave your TV on so loud when you go out.  That creep down the hall phoned the manager.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I thought I turned it off.  I guess I forgot.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Oh, Dana, it's you.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Hi, Louis.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Hey, it's crazy in here.  You're missing a classic party.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Well, actually Louis I have a friend coming by.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Great!  Bring her, too.  But you better hurry.  I made nachos with non-fat cheese and they're almost gone.  I'll make some more though.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Fine, Louis.  We'll stop in for a drink.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I got the Twister game for later ...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Are you the Gatekeeper?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I am Zuul.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Oh, sure.  I'm getting used to this.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I'm innocent!  Honest, Dana.  I never touched you.  Not that I remember anyway.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: All right, what happened to me?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Hello.  I'm Peter Venkman.  May I help you?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Yes ... well ... I'm not sure.  What I have to say may sound a little ... unusual.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: We're all professionals here, Miss ...

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Barrett.  Dana Barrett.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: ... and then I opened the door again but it was gone.  There was nothing there.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: So what do you think it was?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Why would anyone make up a thing like that?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Some people like the attention.  Some people are just crazy.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Is that your professional opinion?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: It's in the stars.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: No, just that one word -- Zuul -- but I have no idea what it means.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Spengler,  see if you can find the word "Zuul" in any of the literature.  I'll take Miss Barrett home and check out her apartment.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Have you ever thought of moving out -- at least until this disturbance blows over?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: No.  If I moved out now I'd be acknowledging that what happened was real.  I'm not ready to do that.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: You play the cello!  It's my favorite instrument.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Really?  Do you have a favorite piece?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I'd have to say Prokofiev's third concerto.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: That's a violin concerto.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Yeah, but it's got a great cello break.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: You really don't act like a scientist.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: No?  What do I act like?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Like a used car salesman.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Thanks.  What's in there?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: That's too bad.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Nothing.  Is that the kitchen?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Well, let's check it out.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I'll wait here if you don't mind.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: You're quite a housekeeper.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I told you, I ...

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I know.  It happened by itself.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Damn!

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: There's nothing there now and I don't get any significant readings.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: This is terrible.  Either there's a monster in my kitchen or I'm completely crazy.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: If it's any comfort to you, I don't think you're crazy.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Thanks.  Coming from you that really means a lot to me.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I'm a qualified psychologist.  I've got a degree and everything.  I believe that something happened here and I want to do something about it.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: All right.  What do you want to do?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I think I should spend the night here.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: That's it.  Get out.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: On a purely scientific basis.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Out!

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I want to help you.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I'll scream.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Don't scream.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Then leave.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Okay, okay.  But if anything else happens, you have to promise you'll call me.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Okay.  Then I'll go.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: No kiss?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Great rehearsal.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: You heard it?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: You're the best one in your row.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Most people can't hear me with the whole orchestra playing.  You're good.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I don't have to take abuse from you.  I have other people dying to give it to me.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I know.  You're quite a celebrity these days.  Are you here because you have info ... about my case?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Who's the stiff?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: The "stiff?"  He happens to be one of the finest musicians in the world and a wonderful man.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Is he dying or something?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: He is a very close friend.  Do you have some explanation of what happened in my apartment?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Yes, but I have to tell you in private at a fine restaurant.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Can't you tell me now?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I'll cancel the reservation,  I found the name "Zuul" in ...  The Roylance Guide to Secret Societies and Sects.  I don't suppose you've  read it.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: You must have gotten the last copy.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Well, the name Zuul refers to a demi-god worshipped around 6000 B.C. by the ... What's that say?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Hittites,  the Mesopotamians and the Sumerians.  "Zuul was the Minion of Gozer."

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: "Gozer" -- he was very big in the Sumerian religion.  One of their gods.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: What's he doing in my refrigerator.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I'm checking on that.  I think we should meet Thursday night at nine to talk about it.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I don't think so.  I'm busy Thursday night.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: You think I enjoy giving up my evenings to spend time with clients?  I'm making an exception because I respect you as an artist and as a dresser.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: All right.  Since you put it that way.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I'll pick you up at your place.  I'll bring along the Roylance Guide -- we can read after we eat.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I've got to go now.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Hey, Dana.  What is it?  What happened?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I am Zuul.  I am the Gatekeeper.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: We must prepare for the coming of Gozer.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Okay, I'll help you.  Should we make some dip or something?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: He is the Destructor.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Really?  Can't wait to meet him.  As long as we're waiting for him, I'd really like to try something with you -- in the bedroom.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Do you want this body?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Well, I'll just use it for a while and get it right back to you.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Take me now.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Actually, it's more of a policy than a rule.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I want you inside me.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I don't know.  You've got two people in there already.  It could get a little crowded.  I want you to close your eyes and relax.  Now I'm going to speak to Dana and I want Dana to answer.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I am Zuul.  I am ...

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Right ... You're the Gatekeeper.  But I want Dana.  Dana, speak to me ...

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: There is no Dana.  I am Zuul.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Whoa!! Nice voice.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Nothing!  We just got rid of that thing in your kitchen.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Really!  Is it gone?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Yeah, along with most of your furniture and a lot of your personal possessions.  This one took some work.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Thank you.  Next time I want to break a lease I'll know who to call.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: This is going to cost you, you know.  Our fees are ridiculously high.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Talk to my accountant.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I trust you're moving us to a better space somewhere on campus.

turns.speaker: DEAN YAEGER
turns.text: No, we're moving you OFF CAMPUS.  The Board of Regents has decided to terminate your grant.  You are to vacate these premises immediately.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: This is preposterous!  I demand an explanation.

turns.speaker: DEAN YAEGER
turns.text: Fine.  This University will no longer continue any funding of any kind for your group's activities.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: But why?  The students love us!

turns.speaker: DEAN YAEGER
turns.text: Dr. Venkman, we believe that the purpose of science is to serve mankind.  You, however, seem to regard science as some kind of "dodge" or "hustle."  Your theories are the worst kind of popular tripe, your methods are sloppy and your conclusions are highly questionable.  You're a poor scientist, Dr. Venkman, and you have no place in this department or in this University.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: SECOND BUM
turns.text: That is one speedy mutt.

turns.speaker: FIRST BUM
turns.text: He's a big one.  You don't want to mess with that particular breed.

turns.speaker: SECOND BUM
turns.text: Definitely some sort of fighting Spaniel, I think.

turns.speaker: FIRST BUM
turns.text: Well, that definitely looks like marshmallow to me.

turns.speaker: SECOND BUM
turns.text: Yeah, it's some kind of mallow-type substance - that's for sure.

turns.speaker: FIRST BUM
turns.text: You have to wonder why anybody would dump a marshmallow that size right in the middle of the street.

turns.speaker: SECOND BUM
turns.text: I wonder if there might not be a very large cup of hot chocolate somewhere in the area.

turns.speaker: FIRST BUM
turns.text: That would definitely explain it.

turns.speaker: HEAD LIBRARIAN
turns.text: Hello, I'm Roger Delacorte - the Head Librarian.  Are you the men from the University?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Yes.  I'm Dr. Venkman and this is Dr. Stantz.

turns.speaker: HEAD LIBRARIAN
turns.text: Thank you for coming.  I'd appreciate it if we could take care of this quickly and quietly.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: One thing at a time.  We don't even know what it is yet.

turns.speaker: HEAD LIBRARIAN
turns.text: What's that got to do with it?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Back off, man!  I'm a scientist!

turns.speaker: HEAD LIBRARIAN
turns.text: Did you see it?  What was it?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: We'll get back to you.

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: You're very handy, I can tell.  I bet you like to read a lot, too.

turns.speaker: SPENGLER
turns.text: Print is dead.

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: That's very fascinating to me.  I read a lot myself.  Some people think I'm too intellectual.  But I think reading is a fabulous way to spend your spare time.  I also play racketball.  Do you ever play?

turns.speaker: SPENGLER
turns.text: Is that a game?

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: It's a great game!  You should play sometime.  I bet you'd be good.  You seem very athletic.  Do you have any hobbies?

turns.speaker: SPENGLER
turns.text: I collect spores, molds and fungus.

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: Oh, that's very - unusual.

turns.speaker: SPENGLER
turns.text: I think it's the food of the future.

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: Remind me not to go to lunch with you.

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: Egon, there's something very strange about that man.  I'm very psychic usually and right now I have this terrible feeling that something awful is going to happen to you.  I'm afraid you're going to die.

turns.speaker: SPENGLER
turns.text: Die in what sense?

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: In the physical sense.

turns.speaker: SPENGLER
turns.text: I don't care.  I see us as tiny parts of a vast organism, like two bacteria living on a rotting speck of dust floating in an infinite void.

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: That's so romantic.

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: I want you to have this.

turns.speaker: SPENGLER
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: It's a souvenir from the 1964 World's Fair at Flushing Meadow.  It's my lucky coin.

turns.speaker: SPENGLER
turns.text: I don't believe in luck.

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: Keep it anyway.  I have another one at home.

turns.speaker: SPENGLER
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Why don't you step into the office and we'll talk about it.  Hold all my calls, Janine.

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: What calls?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Here's the paper on the Brooklyn job.  She paid with a Visa card.

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: Here are tonight's calls.

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: And someone from the EPA is here to see you.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: The EPA?  What's he want?

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: I didn't ask him.  All I know is that I haven't had a break in two weeks and you promised you'd hire more help.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Janine, I'm sure a woman with your qualifications would have no trouble finding a top flight job in the housekeeping or food service industry.

turns.speaker: JANINE
turns.text: Oh, really?  Well, I've quit better jobs than this one, believe me.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Thank you for coming so quickly.  The guests are starting to ask questions and I'm running out of excuses.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Has this ever happened before?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Well, most of the original staff knows about the twelfth floor ... The disturbances, I mean ... But it's been quiet for years ... Up until two weeks ago ... It was never ever this bad, though.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Did you ever report it to anyone?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Heavens, no!  The owners don't like us to even talk about it.  I hoped we could take care of this quietly tonight.

turns.speaker: STANTZ
turns.text: Yes, sir.  Don't worry.  We handle this kind of thing all the time.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Can I help you?

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: I'm Walter Peck.  I represent the Environmental Protection Agency, Third District.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Great!  How's it going?

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: Are you Peter Venkman?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Yes, I'm Doctor Venkman.

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: Exactly what are you a doctor of, Mr. Venkman?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I have Ph.D's in psychology and parapsychology.

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: I see.  And now you catch ghosts?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: You could say that.

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: And how many ghosts have you caught, Mr. Venkman?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: I'm not at liberty to say.

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: And where do you put these ghosts once you catch them?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: In a storage facility.

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: And would this storage facility be located on these premises?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Yes, it would.

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: And may I see this storage facility?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: No, you may not.

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: And why not, Mr. Venkman?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Because you didn't say the magic word.

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: And what is the magic word, Mr. Venkman?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: The magic word is "please."

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: May I please see the storage facility?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Why do you want to see it?

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: Well, because I'm curious.  I want to know more about what you do here.  Frankly, there have been a lot of wild stories in the media and we want to assess any possible environmental impact from your operation. For instance, the storage of noxious, possibly hazardous waste materials in your basement.  Now either you show me what's down there or I come back with a court order.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Go ahead!  Get a court order.  Then I'm gonna sue your ass off for wrongful prosecution.

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: Have it your way, Mr. Venkman.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Hey!  Make yourself useful!  Go save a tree!

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: At ease, Officers.  I'm Peter Venkman.  I think there's been some kind of misunderstanding here and I want to cooperate in every way I can.

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: Forget it, Venkman.  You had your chance to cooperate but you thought it was more fun to insult me.  Now it's my turn, smart-ass.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: You turned off the power!  Look, there was another man here ... You have to find him and bring him back.  A short determined-looking guy with the eyes of a happy zombie.

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: See!  They are using drugs.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: The man is a psychopath, Your Honor.

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: Probably a mixture of gases, no doubt stolen from the Army ...

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Mr. Mayor, it's a pretty simple choice. You can believe Mr. Pecker here ...

turns.speaker: PECK
turns.text: That's "Peck!"

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: ... or you can accept the fact that this city is heading for a disaster of really Biblical proportions.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: All right.  What is it?

turns.speaker: SOPHOMORE
turns.text: A square?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Good guess -- but no.

turns.speaker: SOPHOMORE
turns.text: Circle?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Close -- but definitely wrong.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Nervous?

turns.speaker: SOPHOMORE
turns.text: Yes.  I don't like this.

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Well, just 75 more to go.  What's this one?

turns.speaker: SOPHOMORE
turns.text: Two wavy lines?

turns.speaker: VENKMAN
turns.text: Sorry.  This isn't your day.
